thread.title: Nick, 10, likes Wii, reading
thread.title_full: Nick, 10, likes Wii, reading | Boston Herald

author: Ayâ€™s Child
title: Nick, 10, likes Wii, reading
text:
Nick is a fun-loving 10-year-old Caucasian boy who is creative and loves to sing. He is caring and polite. His hobbies include reading, playing Wii, using his bug-catching kit, playing soccer, building with Legos and listening to music. He has a vivid imagination and likes to engage in role-playing games while active outside or inside with action figures. Nick enjoys one-on-one attention and also enjoys playing independently. Nick has played on a town soccer team for two seasons and would like to explore some new activities, too.
Nick helps with such household chores as putting away silverware and sweeping the porch. He makes his bed and keeps his room neat. Nick loves dogs and is really good with them. He likes all kinds of pets and is interested in animals.
Nick is smart and does well academically. He does his homework every night cheerfully and quickly. He is in a regular education classroom but accesses school counselors when needed.
The ideal family for Nicholas is a two-parent or single-parent family of any constellation that is able to provide him with a lot of structure. A future family should be open to maintaining birth family connections. Nicholas has done well with his foster family but is ready to find his forever family.
To learn more about Nick and about adoption from foster care, call MARE at 617-542-3678 or go to mare inc.org.
